snippet: Rebekah Brooks, in her phone hacking trial, gave a rare view into the skating-on-the-edge culture of the popular press.
abstract: Testimony of former tabloid editor Rebekah Brooks in her phone hacking trial offers a rare view into the skating-on-the-edge culture of popular press in Great Britain, one that fascinates and revolts Britons in equal measure; she is accused of condoning illegal interception of mobile phone voice mail messages as editor of The News of the World, sensational weekly that Rupert Murdoch shut down over scandal.
lead_paragraph: Rebekah Brooks, in her phone hacking trial, gave a rare view into the skating-on-the-edge culture of the popular press.

headline.main: Testimony at Hacking Trial Gives Peek Into British Tabloids
headline.print_headline: Testimony at Hacking Trial Gives Peek Into British Tabloids

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
